channel.title: Michael Enger
channel.description: I am a professional. This is my website.

item.title: raylib vs. Godot: A Highly Subjective Comparison
item.description: The year is 2024 and I'm itching to do some game development. With the myriad of choices available to me, which one actually appeals the most?
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: Seeding RNG Without the Current Time
item.description: When developing a game for a fantasy console that doesn't have the concept of time I needed a way to seed the Random Number Generator.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: 2023 In Review
item.description: I went to a lot of concerts in 2023 and here are some of the new artists I discovered.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: The Mac Needs Proton
item.description: As a frustrated "Mac Gamer" I desperately wish Apple would just concede the fight and work with Steam to make Windows games work better on macOS.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: Implementing Search for a Pure Frontend Application
item.description: If you're running a web app that has no backend and all the data is stored locally, you may be able to use this technique to implement search on the data.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: Why I Pay For Search
item.description: From a desire to avoid being tracked in everything I do, I am willing to pay to search the Internet.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: Using JSON as a Data Store for a TypeScript Application
item.description: I build a web app which has no backend and opted for storing all the data as JSON files.
item.author: Michael Enger

item.title: Brage 2.0: Redesigning My Static Site Generator
item.description: I've updated my home-grown static site generator to support blog posts!
item.author: Michael Enger
